body:
The explanation for the race makes sense to me. Changing https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/blob/35c36c42455ecd273ea6ced35342d88978c598f2/src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/worker/WorkerSpawnRunner.java#L97 to be `static` should fix this, right? Overflows should be totally fine.

Would you be interested in sending a PR?
I'm happy to open a PR. Will this change necessarily fix the issue? I'm not sure if `WorkerSpawnRunner` is constructed within the Bazel client or the Bazel server process.

> I'm happy to open a PR. Will this change necessarily fix the issue? I'm not sure if `WorkerSpawnRunner` is constructed within the Bazel client or the Bazel server process.

We need to test it to be sure, but the Bazel client is C++ only - you can safely assume that all Java code is part of the server process.
Ah, TIL. I'll test it and let you know if that fixes the issue. Thanks!

If you're using Bazelisk, you can point to the latest RC by setting USE_BAZEL_VERSION=8.3.0rc1. Thanks!
